title: Names in Bridi
goal: Use `la` to put names in any sumti position within full sentences.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Quick person word drill — translate to English:

1. la .bob. cu nanmu   → ?
2. ninmu cu cadzu      → ?
3. verba cu sipna      → ?
4. la .alis. cu prenu  → ?

(Answers: Bob is a man. A woman walks. A child sleeps. Alice is a person.)

Now say each aloud with correct pronunciation.

New Material (5-7 min)

Names as Sumti

mi tavla la .alis. — I talk to Alice.

You've used names with vocatives (coi la .alis.). Now you'll use them as regular sumti — filling the x1, x2, or any place in a bridi.

la Makes a Name into a Sumti

The word la means "the one(s) called." It turns a cmevla into a sumti:

Lojban Gloss English
la .alis. [the-one-called Alice] Alice
la .bob. [the-one-called Bob] Bob
la .paris. [the-one-called Paris] Paris

You can put la .name. anywhere a sumti goes.

Names in Different Positions

x1 position (before selbri):

Lojban Gloss English
la .alis. cu klama Alice [cu] go Alice goes.
la .bob. cu citka Bob [cu] eat Bob eats.
la .paris. cu melbi Paris [cu] beautiful Paris is beautiful.

x2 position (after selbri):

Lojban Gloss English
mi tavla la .alis. I talk-to Alice I talk to Alice.
mi prami la .bob. I love Bob I love Bob.
do klama la .paris. you go-to Paris You go to Paris.

Both x1 and x2:

Lojban Gloss English
la .bob. cu prami la .alis. Bob [cu] love Alice Bob loves Alice.
la .alis. cu tavla la .bob. Alice [cu] talk-to Bob Alice talks to Bob.
la .tam. cu klama la .lyndyn. Tom [cu] go-to London Tom goes to London.

Place Names Work Too

Cities, countries, and places follow the same rules:

Lojban English
la .paris. cu melbi Paris is beautiful.
mi klama la .tokios. I go to Tokyo.
la .lyndyn. cu barda London is big.

Key Point

la .name. can fill any sumti slot — x1, x2, x3, etc. Use cu after names in x1 position to mark where the selbri starts.

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Translation (Lojban → English)

  1. la .alis. cu tcidu
  2. mi prami la .meris.
  3. la .bob. cu tavla la .tam.
  4. la .paris. cu melbi .i la .lyndyn. cu barda
  5. verba cu prami la .alis.
Answers
  1. Alice reads.
  2. I love Mary.
  3. Bob talks to Tom.
  4. Paris is beautiful. London is big.
  5. A child loves Alice.

Exercise 2: Translation (English → Lojban)

  1. I go to Paris.
  2. Alice loves Bob.
  3. Tom eats.
  4. Mary talks to Alice.
  5. London is good. Tokyo is beautiful.
Answers
  1. mi klama la .paris.
  2. la .alis. cu prami la .bob.
  3. la .tam. cu citka
  4. la .meris. cu tavla la .alis.
  5. la .lyndyn. cu xamgu .i la .tokios. cu melbi

Exercise 3: Create 5 Original Bridi

Write 5 sentences using at least:

  • 2 different names
  • 3 different gismu from Week 1
  • At least one sentence with a name in x2 position

Say each aloud.

Example answers
  • la .bob. cu cadzu
  • mi tavla la .alis.
  • la .meris. cu prami la .tam.
  • la .paris. cu melbi
  • la .alis. cu ciska .i la .bob. cu tcidu

items.answer: Paris is beautiful. London is big.

items.text: London is good. Tokyo is beautiful.

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "I love Alice." → mi prami la .alis.
  2. "Bob goes to Paris." → la .bob. cu klama la .paris.
  3. "Alice talks to Bob. Bob loves Alice." → la .alis. cu tavla la .bob. .i la .bob. cu prami la .alis.

Create your own: a sentence where [your name] does something to [a friend's name].

Today's Vocab

No new gismu today — focus on using names fluently.

Pattern summary:

Pattern Example
Name as x1 la .alis. cu klama (Alice goes)
Name as x2 mi prami la .bob. (I love Bob)
Two names la .alis. cu tavla la .bob. (Alice talks to Bob)
Place names la .paris. cu melbi (Paris is beautiful)

Summary

You learned to use la .name. in any sumti position. Names can be the doer (x1), the recipient (x2), or fill any place in a bridi. You practiced building sentences with named people and places.

Tomorrow preview: You'll learn zdani (home), sutra (fast), and barda (big) — and start describing things with multiple qualities.
